Articles.Content: Tom Robin made this animated short video, in which he wanted to tell the story that many KSP players will recognize. [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/127522](**Let him know** what you think!

This video is so true! I think it is obligatory for the new player to have mun landing mission, rescue mission, rescue-rescue mission and if you get lucky you will save all kerbals with rescue-rescue-rescue mission. On which you usually take amount of dv enough to land on other planet and come back, one extra rocket as an assembly to the lander in the case lander gets broken, laboratory, for making mun station and etc....![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
This is an awesome video style!

> 
> Reminds me of this one.
> http://www.kerbalcomics.com/2012/06/22/episode-ten-stranded-squared/[http://www.kerbalcomics.com/comics/2012-06-22-episode-ten-stranded-squared.png](http://www.kerbalcomics.com/comics/2012-06-22-episode-ten-stranded-squared.png)

Me too ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Oh... if only they had a fuel pipe.

Eh heh heh. Feels like yesterday I was doing that, but I guess with mistakes come lessons. When I began KSP I didn't know you had to kill your sideways velocity, or at least how to. I was always trying to get an approach to the Mun that went straight down. Good old days, eh?
Thats What Kas and Kis are for xD

heh, playin with kis/kas, mks and extraplanetary launchpads, i sent a big lander full of parts to my stranded kerbals since i tend to break my rockets apart when landing wrong, right now im surveying a mun/minmius for a good spot for my first base. ( sooon i shall concuor da muns)
